title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:08 <rrodriguez> has quit  
00:13 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
00:26 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
00:28 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:04 <abusenius> has quit  
01:42 <sdumitriu> has quit  
05:17 <DrLou> has quit  
06:10 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
06:25 <j-saturne> has quit  
07:01 <Denis> has quit  
07:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:10 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:26 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
07:55 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:06 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning. Could you look at this test failure from yesterday night: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/743/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/TabsTest/testSwitchToSourceWithoutHTMLChanges/  
08:18 <vmassol> cjdelisle: good morning too. Could you look at the flickering storage test?  
08:18 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-storage/743/testReport/  
08:19 <@cjdelisle> that's a pain, I can't repeat it and it's either a case of the server not stopping when it's supposed to or it's leaving a lock  
08:20 <@cjdelisle> I think it's leaving the lock because it seems to bind the port alright  
08:27 <@cjdelisle> vmassol: is there a jira issue for this flicker?  
08:28 <vmassol> cjdelisle: unless you've created it, no  
08:28 <@cjdelisle> ok, reporting it now.  
08:28 <@cjdelisle> This might be an issue with HSQL or how we shut the server down after the tests  
08:29 <vmassol> this one happened yesterday too: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-tests/1177/console  
08:29 <vmassol> it's a stuck build  
08:29 <@cjdelisle> For now the only thing I can imagine is to delete the locak file after it's gone  
08:29 <vmassol> looks like either a FF issue or some jenkins one  
08:29 <vmassol> cjdelisle: we do a lot of start/stop in all the other tests  
08:30 <vmassol> and they work fine  
08:30 <vmassol> why do't you do the same?  
08:30 <vmassol> note: I haven't looked at what you did for storage tests$  
08:30 <@cjdelisle> They are the same except that they start the same server again.  
08:31 <@cjdelisle> We start ui/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty..../start.sh  
08:31 <@cjdelisle> than we stop that  
08:31 <@cjdelisle> then we start  
08:31 <vmassol> why do you need to restart it?  
08:31 <@cjdelisle> selenium/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty..../start.sh  
08:32 <@cjdelisle> Because I want to run the same tests with different configuration profiles (using FS attachments and not)  
08:33 <@cjdelisle> And there's an ostensibly orphaned lock file after the server is shut down.  
08:33 <vmassol> hmm that reminds me of soemtihng, hold on  
08:33 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-471  
08:34 <@cjdelisle> lock file [/home/hudsonagent/hudson\_root/workspace/xwiki-enterprise-tests/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-storage/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-SNAPSHOT/database/xwiki\_db.lck] is presumably locked by another process.  
08:34 <@cjdelisle> that's the issue  
08:36 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-tests/1177/console could also be a selenium issue in the way it starts FF  
08:40 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <j-saturne1> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <j-saturne> has quit  
08:48 <@cjdelisle> Oh, storage tests run at orders of magnitude faster than the equivilant ui-tests  
08:48 <@cjdelisle> I was blown away by the speed of the document rollback test.  
08:50 <@cjdelisle> I think that in the long term we are going to need to move to a unified RPC API and have the front end be a consumer of that API, then we can do functional tests agains the API and minimize the need for flakey ui-tests.  
08:57 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <@cjdelisle> http://in.relation.to/Bloggers/HibernateCore400Beta1Release  
09:04 <@cjdelisle> http://in.relation.to/Bloggers/HibernateCore365Final  
09:06 <+mflorea> vmassol: I need to finish something for wiki30 and then I'll handle the WYSIWYG editor tests  
09:08 <vmassol> mflorea: ok  
09:08 <vmassol> bb in 20mn  
09:20 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: regarding XE-952 . It's odd that the lck file is not deleted.  
10:11 <vmassol> sburjan: why? the database isn't stopped so why would it be deleted?  
10:12 <vmassol> bb in 2 mn  
10:12 <vmassol> has quit  
10:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <+sburjan> vmassol: afaik the database is started by xwiki upon starting, right ?  
10:15 <+sburjan> I'm talking about the jetty-hsqldb bundle  
10:16 <@cjdelisle> the db is supposed to be stopped  
10:16 <@cjdelisle> If you know something I don't then please tell  
10:18 <+sburjan> all I know I encountered \_exactly\_ the same problem when using the mvn jetty:run plugin, and when changing something, it redeployed automatically. but for some reason, I got the same lck file error  
10:18 <+sburjan> so I hat to put a option in the connection URL string to aviod that  
10:19 <+sburjan> \*had  
10:19 <@cjdelisle> could you write that in a comment on the issue? I don't know why it is doing that, it should be stopped.  
10:20 <+sburjan> dunno how it's ran on the CI server. I encountered this using H2, not hsqldb.  
10:20 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:20 <@cjdelisle> hmm maybe a different issue  
10:21 <@cjdelisle> if it was not stopped then the port would not be able to be bound so I know the vm is stopped  
10:21 <+sburjan> wait. are we using tcp connection or file ? because afaik on standard jetty-hsqldb we are using file. so no tcp server is started  
10:21 <@cjdelisle> so that tells me that there might be an issue with either HSQL or the way we stop it.  
10:22 <vmassol> cjdelisle: the db is never stopped  
10:22 <@cjdelisle> never?  
10:22 <vmassol> well it's stopped when  
10:22 <vmassol> the java process is stopped  
10:22 <vmassol> hsqldb must have some shutdown hook  
10:23 <vmassol> but if you don't stop the java process we never stop the db  
10:23 <vmassol> and we should  
10:23 <vmassol> that's the point of the issue I mentioned  
10:23 <+sburjan> in H2 i had to put AUTO\_SERVER=TRUE in connection URL in order to allow other processed to access the db  
10:23 <+sburjan> but I'm not sure this will do for us  
10:23 <vmassol> we're not using H2 sburjan  
10:24 <@cjdelisle> ok so XWikiExecutor#stop() doesn't actually fullfill it's contract?  
10:24 <vmassol> and we're not using hsqldb in server mode  
10:24 <vmassol> cjdelisle: correct  
10:24 <+sburjan> I know. we're using hsqldb in file mode, right ?  
10:24 <vmassol> sburjan: no, in embedded mode  
10:24 <vmassol> (run in the same jvm)  
10:24 <vmassol> (nothing to do with files)  
10:25 <+sburjan> I might have found something  
10:25 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I did something for the packager plugin AFAIR, hold on  
10:26 <vmassol>         // We MUST shutdown HSQLDB because otherwise the last transactions will not be flushed  
10:26 <vmassol>         // to disk and will be lost. In practice this means the last Document imported has a  
10:26 <vmassol>         // very high chance of not making it...  
10:26 <vmassol>         // TODO: Find a way to implement this generically for all databases and inside  
10:26 <vmassol>         // XWikiHibernateStore (cf http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-471).  
10:26 <vmassol>         shutdownHSQLDB(context);  
10:26 <vmassol> let me find the github link  
10:27 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/tool/backup/Importer.java  
10:27 <vmassol> look at shutdownHSQLDB  
10:28 <@cjdelisle> ugh  
10:28 <vmassol> you could reuse this for the executor  
10:28 <vmassol> to shut it down  
10:28 <@cjdelisle> technical debt everywhere and I do not have time to rewrite the exector or anything  
10:29 <vmassol> either find a generic way to shutdown db, that's XWIKI-471  
10:29 <vmassol> or find a place where to put that code in common  
10:29 <+sburjan> we we sure this is not a concurrency issue ? A new instance of xwiki is starting while the older one isn't completely shut down ?  
10:29 <vmassol> and reuse it from packager + executor  
10:29 <vmassol> sburjan: it is  
10:29 <vmassol> since the DB is not stopped  
10:30 <vmassol> and we're trying to start it again  
10:30 <vmassol> the alternative  
10:30 <vmassol> is to add some check in our hibernate storage code  
10:30 <vmassol> to not try to start the DB if it's already started  
10:30 <+sburjan> I'm interested in this issue because I also ran in with it  
10:30 <vmassol> but not very nice IMO  
10:31 <+sburjan> vmassol: yes, this is what i've done with h2, I agree, not nice.  
10:31 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I really don't think that 5a0645115e68cea6980b19254401bad2f662e3ff is good  
10:32 <vmassol> you're going to put the DB in a bad state (high risk)  
10:32 <@cjdelisle> The whole executor system is IMO a mass of spit and ducttape, I will have time to repair it in September.  
10:32 <vmassol> much better to shutdown the DB  
10:32 <vmassol> cjdelisle: sure, I'm not suggesting to clean the code  
10:32 <vmassol> but to shutdown the DB  
10:32 <vmassol> in executor#stop  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> How many things am I going to break hacking a change into that?  
10:33 <vmassol> what issue do you see?  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> It's a mess and I'm afraid to touch it  
10:33 <vmassol> it's working fine for the packager plugin  
10:33 <vmassol> what?  
10:34 <vmassol> not really  
10:34 <vmassol> I'"ve touched it several times  
10:34 <vmassol> it's not a mess  
10:34 <vmassol> and it's easy to undestand  
10:34 <vmassol> I don't undersdtand what you're saying  
10:34 <vmassol> OTOH what you've just done is a real mess  
10:34 <vmassol> :)  
10:34 <@cjdelisle> It's fragile  
10:34 <vmassol> deleting the lock file  
10:34 <vmassol> that's really the worse thing to do IMO  
10:35 <vmassol> you're hijacking the internal mecanism of the DB without knowing internally what it'll do  
10:35 <@cjdelisle> Maybe I need to remove the storage tests until I have time to repair the executor.  
10:35 <vmassol> it's a 5 mn job  
10:35 <vmassol> ok I'll do it since you don't want to do it  
10:36 <vmassol> can you please revert your lock deletion?  
10:36 <vmassol> I'll do the DB shutdown  
10:36 <@cjdelisle> thanks  
10:36 <@cjdelisle> can do  
10:36 <+sburjan> have you looked at the shutdown param from connection string ?  
10:37 <+sburjan> they say it's useful for tests, etc . but I'm not sure if this could help us  
10:37 <+sburjan> This command has two uses. One is for test suites, where connections to the database are made from one JVM context, immediately followed by another context. The other use is for applications where it is not easy to configure the environment to shutdown the database. Examples reported by users include web application servers, where the closing of the last connection coincides with the web app being shut down.  
10:38 <@cjdelisle> To my credit, when I committed that I had no idea why that was actually happening, I thought HSQL was leaving a dangling lock.  
10:39 <vmassol> cjdelisle: hmm actually I'm not sure if stopping the db is going to work fine….  
10:39 <vmassol> since we're stopping the java process already  
10:39 <vmassol> it should stop the DB too  
10:39 <vmassol> ok I'll still force it to eb sure and we'll see if it helps  
10:41 <vmassol> hmmm actually it's not easy to do since it has to be done on the server side…. so we do need to introduce an API. I'm going to introduce it in the HibernateStore class while waiting for a more generic one, ok?  
10:41 <vmassol> (that way I can also be shared with teh packager plugin)  
10:41 <@cjdelisle> \*nod\*  
10:42 <vmassol> we alreayd have a shutdownHibernate btw  
10:43 <vmassol> I wonder if that shutdown the DB too, prolly not  
10:43 <+sburjan> vmassol: look at my suggestion above  
10:44 <vmassol> sburjan: link?  
10:44 <vmassol> (I remember looking at it 5 yeasr ago but I don't remember the details)  
10:45 <+sburjan> http://hsqldb.org/doc/2.0/guide/dbproperties-chapt.html#conn\_props-sect  
10:45 <+sburjan> check the 12.8. Automatic Shutdown  
10:45 <vmassol> we're not using 2.0 AFAIK  
10:46 <vmassol> but I remember it's there for earlier version  
10:46 <vmassol> so this combined with shutdownHibernate could work  
10:47 <+sburjan> http://hsqldb.org/doc/guide/ch01.html#N101DB  
10:47 <+sburjan> this is an earlier version  
10:47 <vmassol> ah interesting  
10:47 <vmassol> From version 1.7.2, in-process databases are no longer closed when the last connection to the database is explicitly closed via JDBC, a SHUTDOWN is required. In 1.8.0, a connection property, shutdown=true, can be specified on the first connection to the database (the connection that opens the database) to force a shutdown when the last connection closes.  
10:47 <vmassol> so they changed it  
10:48 <vmassol> now we need to be sure it's safe to have shutdown=true in production  
10:48 <vmassol> it looks safe though  
10:49 <@cjdelisle> Is there a way to prove that the process has stopped?  
10:49 <vmassol> cjdelisle: our script provies it  
10:49 <vmassol> it's blocking  
10:49 <vmassol> stop\_xwiki.sh  
10:49 <@cjdelisle> If that was true then I wouldn't be getting dangling locks would I?  
10:50 <@cjdelisle> Or are they lasting because HSQL is shutdown "wrong"?  
10:50 <vmassol> see my question above  
10:50 <vmassol> at 10:39  
10:51 <@cjdelisle> hehe my clock isn't even accurate for eastern time ;)  
10:51 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I woul dhave expected hsqldb to have a shutdown hook to close itself  
10:51 <vmassol> but they say in the doc: "From version 1.7.2, in-process databases are no longer closed when the last connection to the database is explicitly closed via JDBC, a SHUTDOWN is required"  
10:51 <vmassol> so maybe it's not closed properly  
10:52 <+evalica> sburjan: can you test {{include document="Main.Dashboard"/}} on a space WebHome - it's not working for the 2.1 M2 nor 2.1 RC1. Same for {{dashboard /}}  
10:52 <@cjdelisle> If that file lasted when it is not shutdown properly then users would be complaining that they couldn't start their wiki the second time around.  
10:52 <j-saturne1> has left #xwiki  
10:52 <vmassol> right  
10:52 <@cjdelisle> and that test would fail consistantly, not flicker.  
10:52 <vmassol> unless they have more sublte mechanisms  
10:52 <@cjdelisle> So I really think that the stop() command is not blocking properly.  
10:53 <vmassol> hehe another option:  hsqldb.lock\_file=false  
10:53 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <@cjdelisle> :D  
10:53 <+sburjan> evalica: 2.1 M2 ? We didn't have dashboards in 2.1 :P  
10:53 <+evalica> sburjan3.1  
10:54 <@cjdelisle> Also fixing the blocking doesn't "feel" like the kind of thing that is going to introduce problems for the next 2 months.  
10:54 <@cjdelisle> Messing with that executor just gives me a bad feeling.  
10:55 <vmassol> ok I'm going to shutdown the DB for now since it's the only thing that I know will work and it won't impact production  
10:56 <+sburjan> vmassol: shutdown using the SHUTDOWN from connection string ? or programatically ?  
11:02 <vmassol> hmmm I still don't have a way to externally call the hibernate store....  
11:03 <vmassol> only thing I can think of that's easy would be to set up a jvm shutdown hook but then it impacts production too  
11:03 <vmassol> sburjan: have you done tests with the url connection shutdown=true param?  
11:04 <vmassol> what I'd like to know is whether hibernate closes its connection pool to the DB when the jvm is stopped  
11:04 <vmassol> otehrwise there'll be connection open and the connection param is not going to be doing anything  
11:04 <+sburjan> vmassol: nope. give me the use case. Basically I have to start a xwiki server while the first one is closing ? or how can I test that ?  
11:06 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <vmassol> sburjan: I'm going to implement your suggestion  
11:07 <vmassol> it's the easiest for now  
11:07 <vmassol> googling a bit first  
11:08 <vmassol> ahaha  
11:08 <vmassol> bad  
11:08 <vmassol> http://rubenlaguna.com/wp/2010/01/14/openjpa-hsqldb-and-proper-shutdown/  
11:08 <@cjdelisle> I think we have a problem with blocking. The jvm should not stop without wiping that file and the next jvm must not start until it has stopped.  
11:08 <vmassol> if that's true then it's bad  
11:09 <+sburjan> so my solution falls  
11:09 <vmassol> if the perf is indeed impacted it's bad  
11:09 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <+sburjan> so I guess this proprety is not feasable when using jPA or other ORM's  
11:11 <@cjdelisle> hmm back to my old standby, I'll loop between start\_xwiki.sh ; find the pid# ; stop\_xwiki.sh ; look for pid#  
11:11 <vmassol> cjdelisle: "I think we have a problem with blocking" what makes you sayt his?  
11:11 <vmassol> when you call stop manually  
11:12 <vmassol> you can see that it waits  
11:12 <@cjdelisle> Do you think the file persists forever sometimes?  
11:12 <vmassol> I think I'll need to look at the storage tests first  
11:13 <@cjdelisle> If the jvm is stopped then there is no more opertunity to delete the file so either the file sometimes lasts forever or the stop() is not blocking correctly.  
11:14 <@cjdelisle> It doesn't really have much to do with the storage tests per se, I think it would be the same if the storage tests were executor.start(); executor.stop(); executor.start(); executor.stop();  
11:15 <+sburjan> IMO removing the lock file is actually done by the kernel or by the hsqldb engine ?  
11:16 <vmassol> cjdelisle:  
11:16 <vmassol> In case of a crash, the JVM should be termintated. After this, no lock  
11:16 <vmassol> on database files is maintained. I have found though occassionally in  
11:16 <vmassol> Windows, a lock remains until the OS is restrted.  
11:16 <vmassol> The .lck file is not a dumb device. The next startup will check and wait  
11:16 <vmassol> for a a few seconds, then remove an old .lck file.  
11:16 <vmassol> source: http://old.nabble.com/automatic-shutdown-ts26310707.html#a26310707  
11:16 <@cjdelisle> smart  
11:16 <vmassol> let me check locally if I have a lck file after a stop  
11:17 <+sburjan> nop, lck files should disappear after containter is stopped.  
11:18 <vmassol> it takes a bit of time to remove the lck file it seems  
11:18 <vmassol> vmassol@vincent-massols-macbook-pro ~/Desktop/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-SNAPSHOT $ sh stop\_xwiki.sh; ls database/  
11:18 <vmassol> META-INF                xwiki\_db.lck            xwiki\_db.log            xwiki\_db.properties     xwiki\_db.script  
11:18 <vmassol> vmassol@vincent-massols-macbook-pro ~/Desktop/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-SNAPSHOT $ ls database/  
11:18 <vmassol> META-INF                xwiki\_db.log            xwiki\_db.properties     xwiki\_db.script  
11:18 <+sburjan> yepp  
11:18 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: What did you mean yesterday by XHS?  
11:18 <vmassol> cjdelisle: so that must be it  
11:18 <@cjdelisle> It just looks nice, thanks for gutting all of that class stuff.  
11:18 <+sburjan> so I'd conclude there is some trigger to the kernel, because the lck is removed \_after\_ container is fully stopped.  
11:19 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Ah hibernatestore  
11:19 <@cjdelisle> yes  
11:19 <vmassol> cjdelisle: so either we do a wait at the end of stop script or we loop till the lck file has disappeared  
11:19 <@sdumitriu> FYI I'm converting the migrators to components  
11:20 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
11:20 <@cjdelisle> It looks like you just proved that the stop\_xwiki.sh doesn't really block  
11:20 <@cjdelisle> trying to repeat...  
11:20 <vmassol> it blocks till the jvm is stopped  
11:20 <vmassol> (I think)  
11:21 <vmassol> or maybe not  
11:21 <vmassol> but close  
11:21 <vmassol> it does block for sure  
11:21 <vmassol> you can see it yourself  
11:21 <vmassol> testing again  
11:22 <@cjdelisle>  sh ./stop\_xwiki.sh ; ps ax | grep '^ 1987'  
11:22 <@cjdelisle>  1987 pts/14   Sl+    0:15 java -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=128m -Djetty.port=8080 -Djetty.home=jetty -DSTOP.KEY=xwiki -DSTOP.PORT=8079 -Dfile.encoding=UTF8 -jar jetty/start.jar  
11:22 <@cjdelisle> there it is.  
11:24 <vmassol> indeed you're right  
11:24 <vmassol> it doesn't block  
11:24 <vmassol> so +1 to add a loop for pid  
11:25 <@cjdelisle> sounds awesome  
11:25 <+sburjan> +1 also.  
11:25 <@cjdelisle> compared to the prospect of hacking the executor and XHS and HSQL, +100  
11:25 <vmassol> hehe  
11:25 <vmassol> indeed  
11:25 <vmassol> hmmm back to ci.xwiki.org  
11:25 <vmassol> it's strange  
11:25 <+sburjan> it's hard to work with files :P  
11:26 <vmassol> it's always manager tests that hangs  
11:26 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-tests-3.1/19/console  
11:26 <vmassol> (I think, need to check the history)  
11:26 <vmassol> aborting it again  
11:27 <@cjdelisle> hmm since we've taken it upon ourselves to start busting these flickers, we have found all sorts of real issues, this is great.  
11:28 <vmassol> cjdelisle: are you doing the pid looping?  
11:29 <@cjdelisle> no, I have no time  
11:29 <vmassol> ok I'll do it then....  
11:29 <@cjdelisle> thank you
